tool.name: STAR
tool.description: STAR: Spliced Transcripts Alignment to a Reference
tool.command:
## ## Select genome index or build one if necessary ##
#if $refGenomeSource.genomeSource == "history": stary.py genomeGenerate --limitGenomeGenerateRAM 31000000000 --runThreadN 8 --genomeDir 'genome' --genomeFastafiles $refGenomeSource.genomeFasta --sjdbGTFfile $refGenomeSource.gtfFile --sjdbGTFchrPrefix $refGenomeSource.chrPrefix --sjdbGTFfeatureExon $refGenomeSource.featureExon --sjdbGTFtagExonParentTranscript $refGenomeSource.tagExonParentTranscript --sjdbGTFtagExonParentGene $refGenomeSource.tagExonParentGene --sjdbOverhang $refGenomeSource.sjOverhang #set index_path = 'genome' #else: #set index_path = $refGenomeSource.index.fields.path #end if
## ## Run STAR ##
star.py align
## Defaults (partial list) --quantMode "GeneCounts" --genomeLoad "NoSharedMemory" --runThreadN 8 --outSAMtype "BAM SortedByCoordinate" --twopassMode "Basic" --outFileNamePrefix "./"
## Options --readFilesCommand $readFilesCmd
## reference genome --genomeDir $index_path
## sequencing reads #if $singlePaired.isPaired == "paired": --readFilesIn $singlePaired.input1 $singlePaired.input2 #else: --readFilesIn $singlePaired.input1 #end if
#if $markDup_cond.markDup: --bamRemoveDuplicatesType "UniqueIdentical" #end if
#if $chimeric.detectChimeric: --chimOutType "SeparateSAMold" --chimSegmentMin $chimSegmentMin --chimScoreMin $chimScoreMin --chimScoreSeparation $chimScoreSeparation --chimScoreJunctionNonGTAG $chimScoreJunctionNonGTAG --chimJunctionOverhangMin $chimJunctionOverhangMin #end if
## extra parameters #if $params.settingsType == "full" --outFilterType $params.filterType --outFilterMultimapNmax $params.multiMap --outFilterMismatchNmax $params.misMatch --alignSJoverhangMin $params.SJoverhangMin --alignSJDBoverhangMin $params.SJDBoverhangMin --alignIntronMin $params.minIntron --alignIntronMax $params.maxIntron --alignMatesGapMax $params.maxMatesGap #end if
> $logfile

param.name: genomeSource
param.label: Will you select a reference genome from your history or use a built-in STAR genome index?
param.help: Built-ins were indexed using default options.
param.option: Use a built-in STAR genome index

param.name: chrPrefix
param.label: Prefix for chromosome names in a GTF file
param.help: e.g. ’chr’ for using ENSMEBL annotations with UCSC geneomes

param.name: featureExon
param.label: Feature type in GTF file to be used as exons for building transcripts

param.name: tagExonParentTranscript
param.label: Tag name to be used as exons’ transcript-parents

param.name: tagExonParentGene
param.label: Tag name to be used as exons’ gene-parents

param.name: sjOverhang
param.label: Length of the donor/acceptor sequence on each side of the junctions, ideally = (mate length - 1)

param.name: readFilesCmd
param.label: UncompressionCommand option
param.help: The un-compression command that takes the file name as input parameter, and sends the un-compressed output to stdout.

param.name: input1
param.label: RNA-Seq FASTQ file
param.help: Nucleotide-space: Must have Sanger-scaled quality values with ASCII offset 33

param.name: input1
param.label: RNA-Seq FASTQ file, forward reads
param.help: Nucleotide-space: Must have Sanger-scaled quality values with ASCII offset 33

param.name: input2
param.label: RNA-Seq FASTQ file, reverse reads
param.help: Nucleotide-space: Must have Sanger-scaled quality values with ASCII offset 33

param.name: chimScoreMin
param.label: minimum total (summed) score of the chimeric segment

param.name: chimScoreSeparation
param.label: minimum difference between the best chimeric score and the next one

param.name: chimScoreJunctionNonGTAG
param.label: penalty for a non-GT/AG chimeric junction

param.name: chimJunctionOverhangMin
param.label: minimum overhang for a chimeric junction'

param.name: settingsType
param.label: Settings to use
param.help: You can use the default settings or set custom values for any STAR parameter.

param.name: misMatch
param.label: Number of mismatches per read pair

param.name: SJoverhangMin
param.label: minimum overhang (i.e. block size) for spliced alignments

param.name: SJDBoverhangMin
param.label: minimum overhang (i.e. block size) for annotated (sjdb) spliced alignments

param.name: maxIntron
param.label: Maximum intron size. If 0, max intron size will be determined by (2ˆwinBinNbits)*winAnchorDistNbins

param.name: maxMatesGap
param.label: Maximum genomic gap between the mates. If 0, max intron gap will be determined by (2ˆwinBinNbits)*winAnchorDistNbins

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool uses STAR_ version 2.4.2a to align FASTA or FASTQ reads to a genome.
.. _STAR: https://github.com/alexdobin/STAR
-----
**Outputs**
* Log files [Log.out] * BAM alignments sorted by coordinate [Aligned.sortedByCoord.out.bam] * Mapping summary statistics [Log.final.out] * Splice junctions [SJ.out.tab] * Reads counts per gene [ReadsPerGene.out.tab] * Chimeric alignments in SAM format [Chimeric.out.sam]
-----
**STAR settings**
All off the options have a default value. You can change most of them. Some of the options in STAR have been implemented here.
-----
**STAR Parameter List**
*Dafaults that cannot be modified*
--quantMode "GeneCounts" --genomeLoad "NoSharedMemory" --outSAMtype "BAM SortedByCoordinate" --twopassMode "Basic"
*Options*
--readFilesCommand --runThreadN
--bamRemoveDuplicatesType
--chimOutType --chimSegmentMin --chimScoreMin --chimScoreSeparation --chimScoreJunctionNonGTAG --chimJunctionOverhangMin
--outFilterType --outFilterMultimapNmax --outFilterMismatchNmax --alignSJoverhangMin --alignSJDBoverhangMin --alignIntronMin --alignIntronMax --alignMatesGapMax
-----
**Citation**
For the underlying tool, please cite:
A. Dobin et al, Bioinformatics 2012; doi: 10.1093/bioinformatics/bts635 http://bioinformatics.oxfordjournals.org/content/29/1/15
